column4: Out of interest, I have a graphics card identified as NV5 [RIVA TNT2/TNT2 Pro].. can't seem to get proprietary drivers with 3d acceleration loaded at all.. any ideas?
what type of card is it
It's a Riva TNT2 I think (pci).
isn't that a very very old card
probably why no 3d - support was dropped for old cards
Can't even get a proprietary driver installed.. even though the card is supposedly supported by the nvidia drivers. :/
old card support was dropped from a lot of the newer drivers
really, can you show me the link
what version of the driver are you trying to use
I've tried with the nvidia tools and whatever's in the repository.. can't seem to locate support for the card.
it says your card is only supported in the 1.071 driver
Yup, indeed. Is there a way to force that driver into Ubuntu?
download it manually if it's not in the repo
Will see what I can locate, thanks for the insights.
